summary: Sony, originally Tokyo Tsushin Kogyo, was founded in 1946 by Masaru Ibuka and Akio Morita in Tokyo, Japan. It started as an electronics company, making famous products like transistor radios and the Walkman. Over time, Sony expanded into various businesses like music (CBS Records), movies (Columbia Pictures), and video games (PlayStation). In 2021, it became a holding company. Sony is one of the world's largest companies in image sensors, premium TVs, and is a top TV manufacturer. It's listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and the New York Stock Exchange, and is part of global rankings like the Fortune Global 500 and Forbes Global 2000.
title: Sony
